# Function name: dplyr::across
# Notes:
# .blue[`dplyr::across()`] with .blue[`dplyr::mutate()`] 
.center[.blue[`across`]`(varaibles), function`]
+ The .blue[`across()`] function with .blue[`mutate()`] does the same mutation to multiple variables.
```{r eval=FALSE}
laryngectomy %>% 
  # Convert categorical character variavbles to be factors.
  mutate(
    across(gender:sor, factor)
  ) 
```
+ The .blue[`across()`] function is used with .blue[`dplyr::summarise`] to apply the same summary statistics to many variables.
